gwt.material.design.client.data.infinite

Class InfiniteDataView<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gwt.material.design.client.data.AbstractDataView<T>
      • gwt.material.design.client.data.infinite.InfiniteDataView<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.view.client.HasKeyProvider<T>, DataView<T>, HasCategories, HasColumns<T>, HasDataSource<T>, HasRenderer<T>, HasRows<T>, HasLoader, ViewSettings

    public class InfiniteDataView<T>
extends AbstractDataView<T>
implements HasLoader
    The InfiniteDataView is designed for lazy loading data, while using minimal DOM row elements.
    The data source will invoke a load when the view index changes on scrolling.

    How to use:
    • View size can be configured manually or can be set to dynamic view using DYNAMIC_VIEW.
    • Provide a valid DataSource implementation.
    Author:
    Ben Dol

      • renderRows

        public boolean renderRows(Components<RowComponent<T>> rows)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDataView
        Compile list of RowComponent's and invoke a render. Controls the building of category components and custom components. Which then AbstractDataView.render(Components) is invoked to perform DOM render. Rows which are already rendered are reprocessed based on their equals method. If the data is equal to the row in the same index it use the existing row.
        Overrides:
        renderRows in class AbstractDataView<T>
        Parameters:
        rows - list of rows to be rendered against the existing rows.

      • doSort

        protected boolean doSort(SortContext<T> sortContext,
                         Components<RowComponent<T>> rows)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDataView
        Perform a sort on the a set of RowComponent's. Sorting will check for each components category and sort per category if found.
        Overrides:
        doSort in class AbstractDataView<T>
        Returns:
        true if the data was sorted, false if no sorting was performed.

      • loaded

        public void loaded(int startIndex,
                   List<T> data,
                   int totalRows,
                   boolean cacheData)
        With infinite data loading it is often required to change the total rows, upon loading of new data. See loaded(int, List) for standard use.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the new start index
        data - the new list of data loaded
        totalRows - the new total row count

        public void setLoaderBuffer(int loaderBuffer)
        Description copied from interface: HasLoader
        The amount of data that will buffer your start index and view size. This can be useful in removing loading delays. Defaults to 10.
